div.l: Til in a dich þey caught him atte laste
Wery and wete as a best is in þe reyne
Cometh sely Iohn and with him goth aleyn̄
Allas qduod Iohn þe day þat y was born̄
Now ar we dryven til hething and to squorne
Oure corne is stolen men mow vs fonnes calle
Boþe the wardeyn and oure felawes alle
And namely þe Miller welawey
Þus pleyneth Iohn as he goth by þe wey
Toward þe Mille and bayerd in his honde
The Millewarde sittyng by þe fire he founde
For it was nyght and further myght þey noȝt
But for þe love of god þey him besought
Of herberewe and ese as for hir peny
The Miller seyd ayen if þer be eny
Such as it is yet shal ye have youre part
Myn hous is streyt but ye have y lerned art
Ye kan by argumentz make a place
A myle brode of twenty foote of space
Let se now if þis place may suffise
Or make it rown with spech as is your gise
Now symkym seide by seynt cutberde
Ay is þᵘou mery Iohn and þat is feyre answeredeansweredanswerede
I have herde sey men shal take of twey þynges
Such as he fyndes or two such as he brynges
But specially y prey þe oost deere
Geve vs somme mete and drynke and make vs chere
And we shal payen trewly atte fulle
With empty honde men may no hawkes tulle
Lo here oure siluer redy for to spende
Þis Miller to þe town his doughter sende
For ale and bred and rost hem a goos
And bounde her hors it shulde na mare go loos
And in his owne chambre he made a bedde
With shetes and with chalons feire yspradde
Nought from his owne bedde ten fote ne twelve
His doughter hed a bedde al by hir selue
Right in þe same chambr͗e by and by
It myght be no bette and cause why
Ther was no romer herberew in the place
